title: Shabangin with Hurley Episode 3: The Business of Photography & Finding the Good Side
summary: In this episode, photographer Peter Hurley combines a seminar presentation with a lifestyle vlog. He breaks down the essential roles of a professional photographer, emphasizing the importance of entrepreneurship, and provides a technical tip for quickly identifying a subject's most flattering angle based on their hair part.

steps.action: Adopt the four personas of a successful portrait photographer: Artist, Technician, Director/Therapist, and Entrepreneur.
Treat photography as a business by embracing the entrepreneur role, which is often overlooked by creatives.
Analyze every face that steps in front of the camera to determine the 'good side' versus the 'bad side'.
Determine the subject's best side by looking at their hair part; the side the hair is parted on is the 'good side' 90% of the time.

key_takeaways: Being a great photographer requires more than just taking pictures; you must also be a technician, a director, and a business owner.
Freelancers often neglect the business aspect, but it is a critical piece of the puzzle for a sustainable career.
A quick heuristic for posing is to shoot from the side where the subject parts their hair.
Confidence is a key trait in subjects, as illustrated by the anecdote about a young Ariana Grande.
